GameData:
- -
...You are very repetitive, you know that? -
Scoff. See, I'm saying 'scoff', because when I actually scoff, you don't seem to get it. -
The answer is still no. -
You aren't going to trick me into accepting this deal by asking a bunch of times. That only worked once! -
Hello again. -
Did you forget something? -
Ugh, you're back. -
You again. If you're here because you finally thought of a witty comeback, the moment was lost a long time ago.
-
Welcome back to the Palace of Earth Spirits! Our door is always open for you. -
Hello. After all the nonsense I have had today, it's good to see a friendly face. -
Hello, friend. What do you need? -
Welcome back to the Ancient City. -
What brings you here today? -
Hello again. Not to be rude, but I hope you make this quick; I have several fires to put out and several more to reignite. -
You again. What stupid distraction did you come for this time? -
Ugh. Make it quick, I don't have all day to deal with idiots. -
As if I didn't have enough to deal with, now there's this jerk. -
Even if I'm wounded... the soul still burns! -
I'm willing to see this to the bitter end. I don't know how to do anything else. -
This war is dragging on far too long. -
You wouldn't be here to negotiate peace, would you? -
I could have conquered like three other places in the time our war's taken to slog through. Can we just call it off? -
Here to beg for your life? -
Oh good, you're here. I'm divvying up what I'm going to do with all your stuff once I kill you, maybe you can help. -
Oh look, the dead are walking. -
How's that Research Agreement coming along? -
What is it now? If you're trying to make a fool of me again, it won't work. -
Hello again. How can we help each other? -
{1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} keeps mocking me, prancing around, looking all fancy, not being incinerated. It's an injustice! -
Is it time to obliterate {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} yet? -
I can already smell the ashes of {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}'s hopes and dreams. They smell like... like... Ha-CHOO! -
Let's drag {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} down into hell! Not my hell though. That's where all my stuff is. -
Hello. How's your little war going? It's proving very educational to me. -
Hello. How's your war going? It's proving very educational to me. [NEWLINE]...That kind of came out more menacing than I intended. -
Are you here to officially send those soldiers to a firey death, or are you still going to pretend you don't plan on attacking me? -
Have you ordered your troops away from my borders yet? Because if you haven't, why are you talking to me instead of doing that? -
Have you come to officially give me the settlements you keep making on my land, or are you going to make me take them? -
Oh, it's you again. You must not have walked far, considering how many cities you keep building in my territory. -
If you keep purchasing plots of land to extend into my territory it can only harm our relationship. And by 'harm our relationshp' I mean 'I am going to set you on fire.' -
Stop buying up plots of land I intend to use! It's not my fault that my citizens live underground and it takes longer to buy the whole cave instead of just the part on top. -
Ah, the leader of the largest non-divine, non-atomic military in the surface world! That's still pretty good, right? -
Hello. Can I borrow a couple hundred gold from you? I'm not sure because I don't really do math with this many digits, but I don't think my ledgers are balancing at all. -
When my people want to build a new city, they have to dig one out with shovels and buckets and it's just a huge ordeal. So what the hell is your excuse for having so few cities? -
Oh look. It's Speed Bump the Great, leader of the mighty nation of Target Practice. -
Are you here to declare war on me? I kind of hope you are. That's really the only thing I know how to deal with. -
What the hell do you want? -
I don't have much time to waste and even less of it to waste with you. -
I thought you didn't want to talk to people like me, you only wanted to denounce us! Denounce me. Wait, do I pluralize that... -
Did {1_PlayerName} send you to grovel by proxy? Because it won't work! The divine fury of the Sun can't be grovelled away! -
Are you {1_PlayerName}'s friend? So am I! Maybe if we all get together, Satori will want to join us... I hope... -
I have like four friends in the entire world, so I'm not going to just let you speak ill of {1_PlayerName}. -
You hate {1_PlayerName}? Me too! -
...You want to be my friend? Is this some sort of trick? -
Let me get back to you on that. -
I'm going to denounce {1_CivName}. If you do it with me, then you won't have to look like a copycat for doing it later. -
I'm about to go to war with {1_CivName}. If you want any chance at sifting anything good from the ashes, you should probably be with me on the front lines. Coming? (WILL DECLARE WAR IMMEDIATELY) -
Oh. A betrayal. Satori would have seen this coming. At least I can tell everyone, so they'll see it coming too.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Traitor! Oathbreaker! Fizz... lle... bin! Okay, I thought I knew more words for "traitor" than that, but it's what you are! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I have to turn my back on you. I don't need friends anyway. I have Satori... I will have Satori... [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Oh. While I disagree with your assessment, a respectable leader knows that, uh, letting others defend... No, wait, that wasn't it, I was supposed to defend... Screw it, I'm going to kill you! -
How about I give you a solid hafnium control rod across your teeth, see how much denouncing you do then, huh? -
Ah, so you made an alliance with {1_CivName}. That's cool. I was thinking of that myself. -
I heard you were getting close to {1_CivName}. I wouldn't recommend it. At least not for more than 2 hours at a time -- if you're exposed to an irradiated wasteland for much longer, you might get cancer. -
Hey, I like {1_CivName}! Lay off! -
I hate {1_CivName} as much as you do. Let's kill them all! ...Or was that too forward of me? -
I saw you allied with {1_CivName}. So have I. If you come to the Palace, maybe Satori will hear us having fun, and maybe she'll be happy too... -
I also denounced {1_CivName}. Soon, they'll have no allies left. And then, the obliteration begins... -
How wonderful! Once I'm finished burning {1_CivName} to irradiated ashes, I'll move straight on to destroying you! I was worried I was going to have some downtime there. -
I will not ambivalate any aggression toward {1_CivName}! [NEWLINE]...Is that right? I'm pretty sure that's 'ambivalate.'
-
Stop settling near my lands, because I need those spots, and it's just dangerous for you. Anywhere within atomic-detonation radius of my borders is probably a place for you to avoid. -
You... You lied to me! Did you think that you would get away with that? Did you think that I'm some kind of birdbrain who wouldn't notice, just because I got lost in my own house a few times and spent two hours trying to open a jar of peanut butter the wrong way? Well, I won't stand for it! -
Stop buying up plots of land out from under my empire! Radiation doesn't stop at political borders. -
Were you buying up those plots of land? Someone told me that you couldn't buy land! -
You... You lied to me! Did you think that you would get away with that? Did you think that I'm some kind of birdbrain who wouldn't notice, just because I got lost in my own house a few times and spent two hours trying to open a jar of peanut butter the wrong way? Well, I won't stand for it! -
I'm going to be annihilating one of your insignificant little allies. Don't worry though -- I'll be thinking of you the whole time. -
Orin has informed me that we commenced an attack on a City-State allied with you. So, if any of your imported luxuries arrived encased in molten glass, that, uh, that would be why. [NEWLINE] Sorry... -
Pact of Cooperation proposal (shouldn't appear) -
Staying inside the Palace all day is getting depressing. Orin says I need to make new friends. So... Declaration of Friendship? -
Would you be interested in signing a public Declaration of Friendship? I seek allies to fulfill my atomic ambitions. Also, I only have the one usable hand, so I need help, you know, putting on my shirts and opening things. -
After I condemn you, the other civilizations of the world will avoid you like you're radioactive. Because very soon, you will be. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I'm warning all the other leaders of the world to stay at a minimum safe distance of 50 kilometers from you. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Warmonger (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Citystates (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Taking all the land (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Wonders (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Victory Conditions (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Timeout (shouldn't appear) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} Pact of Secrecy (shouldn't appear) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Will not cause you to declare war) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} Pact of Secrecy end (shouldn't appear) -
It's time for action! {1_PlayerName:textkey} needs to be wiped out for the sake of the world. Will you help? -
This control rod of mine glows with an awesome power! It is telling me to defeat {1_PlayerName:textkey}! Want to help? -
The time has come! Join the war against {1_PlayerName:textkey} like you promised, and criticality will be achieved! -
That's it! For this injustice, I will burn you to ashes! And then I will burn your ashes! And so on, until nothing remains of you but bad memories and a faint odor! -
So. Fate has seen to make us enemies. I guess Fate likes seeing me blow people up. -
No force in the world can stand against our combined might! -
Everything I've done has been for Satori's sake. So why isn't she happy? Who do I have to obliterate to make her smile? -
I sent out more scouts to look for Koishi today. They haven't found her. [NEWLINE] They never find her... -
You are a warmongering menace to the world. That's my job! Quit trying to steal my job! -
You're getting too close to {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. I don't wanna try and cozy up to some other city-state, because I'll just mix up their names.
-
Compared to the Sun, you are but a puny existence. But I still won't show you any sympathy! -
All you shrine maidens look the same to me. -
I have the ultimate power of the Sun! You have... a bad haircut. -
Do you think your forces can stand up to the might of the sun crow? Fancy tricks and techniques are no match for overwhelming power! -
In honesty, my words have always been backed by nuclear weapons. But now, my words are backed by LOTS of nuclear weapons! -
All you do is push around people smaller than you. Which isn't very many people. -
I'm going to wipe out your whole miserable civilization. No, really, all of your citizens are miserable. It's really sad. -
Have you not decided if you want to be a city-state or a full civilization? Because you can't really try to be both like that. I looked it up. -
I could fight off every single citizen in your empire with my control rod tied behind my back. You might think being so pathetically underpopulated would make me feel pity for you, but you'd be wrong! -
Your people have started petitioning me to nuke one of your cities just so they have something pretty to look at.
-
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Attacking the City-State will greatly damage relations and may lead to war. -
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
-
No. -
That's fair. I will tell my citizens to avoid settling near you. All those vengeful spirits shooting out of the ground must be very disconcerting if you aren't used to it. -
You think I should stop setting near your borders? Try and stop me. -
Great, let's shake on it! Just, kind of... grab the control rod and wiggle it. Yeah. -
Pass. -
I'm not feeling it. -
This is a Pact of Secrecy line so it shouldn't appear. -
Will I go to war? Will I go to war? If you had waited ten more minutes, I would have come to you and asked you to join! -
Of course the Palace will help you in your war! The oni are a little drunk right now, but they should clear up in ten turns or so, and then my army will be ready to go! -
Blegh. Whatever. -
It's slightly less effort to give this to you than to melt your face off for insolence. -
Ha! You couldn't even roast a bird with that firepower! What makes you think I'd be afraid of it? -
Does an ant presume to make demands of the Sun? -
Ha! Haha! A-hahahahahahahaha! -
You demand tribute from me? There are far easier and less painful ways of committing suicide, you know. -
No! -
Buzz off. -
I suppose if you're going to do something crazy like make a demand of the nuclear sun crow, may as well go whole hog and make it a ridiculous demand too. But the answer is still no. -
Did I not just tell you the answer was no? [NEWLINE] ...Wait, maybe I didn't just tell you the answer was no. Either way, it's no! -
Quit bugging me!
-
... -
I ask myself what Satori would do, so I'm going to offer you a chance to surrender before I annihilate you. Satori is very kind that way. -
I have other things to do than fight you. Not very many, but still. How does this look to end the war? -
You can give this to me or I can sift it out of the irradiated ashes of your civilization. And believe me, I am fine with either. -
Aaaaaagh! I can't handle this! Everyone doubts me, the other leaders all think I'm stupid, my growth rate is tanking, the only things that aren't on fire are the things that should be on fire! Please, give me a hand here! -
We need you to pay us tribute, so we can keep things running smoothly. And because you appreciate the hard work I am doing. Either or. -
Keeping a Hell of Blazing Fires running is a lot harder than it looks. Satori was doing a lot of behind-the-scenes stuff I didn't know about. Care to lend a hand? -
I've noticed we have a resource surplus. You'd better take it before the oni find out and make liquor out of it. -
I decided to get you a gift, to show you how much I appreciate all your help. But, uh, I wouldn't handle it without gloves if I were you. -
If we open our borders, Rin will have many more graveyards to gather fuel from. -
I want to plan to make a Research Agreement later. But I don't think this text ever actually appears.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Agreeing will not form a Research Agreement yet) -
I need your help to make a Research Agreement between our civilizations. I tried to explain the secrets of nuclear fusion to my scientists, but after the seventh lab blew up we decided it probably wasn't gonna work right. -
This deal was very helpful. Can we just renew it? -
This deal's ready to expire. I think I want some more out of you if you want it renewed.
-
Oh... Wow, thanks! -
Why, thank you! -
Thanks! I can really use this. And if I can't, it will look spectacular when I blow it up! -
That... seems okay? Yeah. Yeah, that's okay. -
That'll do. -
I'll take it. -
Did you really have a choice? -
That's what I thought. -
Done and done. Let's move on. -
I need more than that. -
I'm not going to let you rip me off! -
No way. -
Is this an insult? Are you calling me a birdbrain? NOBODY calls me a birdbrain! Except if they do it affectionately, like Orin does. -
Ha ha, real funny, what was your real offer? -
That looks fine to me already. -
That works for me if it works for you. -
How's this? I hate having to make the offer. -
Does this look good? -
How's this look? -
I can't think of any way to make that work. -
Nothing can make that work.
-
Hahaha, so it's come to this after all! Once I destroy you, the whole world will feel my divine power! -
Hahaha! I've never seen a sinner so eager to get into Hell before! -
Hahaha! Not afraid of the Hell of Blazing Fires? How about I introduce you to a much more terrifying high temperature, high-pressure world! -
Hahaha! You think you have found a weak spot, but my radiant corona has simply blinded you! -
Hahaha! It looks like I have lured your foolish armies into my atomic embrace! -
Hahaha! You want to experience the ultimate power? Come on then, fuse with me! -
Hahaha! You'll never stop my ambition -- you will merely be burned up first! -
Hahaha! At last, I get to do what I'm good at: incinerating fools like you! -
Hahaha! Ha-hahahahahahahahaha! -
Hahaha! Not afraid of the Hell of Blazing Fires? How about I introduce you to a much more terrifying high temperature, high-pressure world! -
Hahaha! I'll take you on with a handicap, it'll keep it exciting! -
Hahaha! Will you escape from me? Or will I simply force you to buzz off? It's a fight! -
No... Why did it have to come to this? Can we really never have a world where satori can be friends with the surface-worlders? -
Why? Of the millions of people I would love to obliterate with fusion power, why do I have to fight you? -
I should have known knew trusting anyone from the surface was a mistake. The people who drove Satori away could never really be my friends.
-
The divine flames I've absorbed will burn you to a crisp with nuclear energy, leaving nothing behind! -
I will melt you away in my atomic fire! -
The corpses of your civilization will fuel my nuclear furnaces! -
If you fell into the Yama's custody, you'd have your innards devoured by snakes for your lies. But me, I'm probably just going to burn you to nothingness. -
I can't stay penned in like this! New caverns and new Hells need to be taken, and the ones underneath your lands look just fine! -
It's time! The missiles are flying, Hallelujah, Hallelujah! -
It's time! Critical mass has been achieved! This world will be broken down to base components to be used in my glorious new fusion! -
It's time! The fusion is imminent! Nothing will stand between me and a glorious, perfect world in flame! -
I'm not preying on your weakness. I'm putting you out of your misery. -
I won't lose! I CAN'T lose! For Satori's sake, I will scourge you from the world! -
It's time to leave this pitiful alliance behind. Prepare yourself! -
I won't lose! I CAN'T lose! For Satori's sake, I will fight any opponent, even you! -
It's not enough... It's never enough. Everything I've done, I still haven't found something that will make Satori smile again. But... burning is all I know how to do, and maybe, maybe I can find what she needs in your ashes... -
It's not enough... It's never enough. Everything I've done, I still haven't found something that will make Satori smile again. But... burning is all I know how to do, and maybe, maybe I can find what she needs in your ashes... -
It's not enough... It's never enough. Everything I've done, I still haven't found something that will make Satori smile again. But... burning is all I know how to do, and maybe, maybe I can find what she needs in your ashes... -
It's not enough... It's never enough. Everything I've done, I still haven't found something that will make Satori smile again. But... burning is all I know how to do, and maybe, maybe I can find what she needs in your ashes... -
Oh. So you would rather I take it from you. I was hoping you'd say that!
-
What will you give me to buy my mercy? -
Make me an offer. Maybe I'll be gracious. -
Okay, that's fine by me. -
This looks like it's in better condition than it'd be if I blew you up to get it, so it's a deal. -
No! The nuclear reactions within me force me to rage even more! -
You can't escape the fury of the Sun! -
You want to give up already? I haven't even seen how quickly your units will melt away!
-
Excellent. -
This is good. -
Neat. -
Thank you. -
Appreciate it! -
Thanks. -
That's a shame. -
Well, that's no good. -
I'm not mad, but I am disappointed. -
So be it. -
Very well. -
You will regret this. -
Oh, that's where those guys are? I guess that explains why nobody's been addressing this pile of post-its I've left for them. So, uh, thanks for the workers back. -
You think that building some weird spiky pointy thing around it makes land yours? [NEWLINE] What? It really does? Well, cut it out! -
Well, at least you're honest. The Yama will appreciate that when I send you their way. -
...I don't believe you, but I'll give you a chance to back down once you realize what a bad idea this is. -
Well, at least you're honest. The Yama will appreciate that when I send you their way. -
...I don't believe you, but I'll give you a chance to back down once you realize what a bad idea this is. -
Big talk for someone so flammable. -
Yes. That's right. -
I said I was sorry! I can't go back and un-melt them, what more do you want? -
How predictable. -
I don't need you. I don't need anyone like you. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Did you decide? -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
My words have always been backed by nuclear weapons, but now they are backed by nuclear weapons that I can launch without having to be, personally, in your face.
-
Ah, another leader who has chosen the path of Freedom! I figured it out -- what Satori really needed was to be free, and then she can be happy. Plus, when things go wrong, now I can blame someone else! -
Ah, another leader who has chosen the path of Order! I figured it out -- what Satori really needed was to feel safe, and then she can be happy. And oni definitely need clear leadership or they just drink all day and start fights about rock music. -
Ah, another leader who has chosen the path of Autocracy! I figured it out -- what Satori really needed was for people to love her. And I thought, if the people won't choose to love her, I will MAKE them love her. So, if you could pass around some pictures and tell all your citizens to love her too, that would be great. -
You are bringing spies into my territory? Are you trying to get me to melt them, or melt you? -
If you keep sending unauthorized people to my incredibly radioactive, highly explosive research labs, something terrible is bound to happen. So really, for both of us, just stop. -
Glad to see you have some sense. -
You resolve to gather intelligence for your empire by throwing more people into a fusion pit? You are really dumb. -
Okay, okay. I'll tell my spies to stay out of your lands. You may want to tell your labs not to use any alcohol solutions, to help keep the oni away. -
I can't pull my spies back! Do you have any idea how hard it is to perform research with a three-foot control rod on one arm and lab assistants who keep getting trashed on rubbing alcohol? You should be thankful I was considerate enough to try and take that research without bothering you, instead of just walking up and demanding it! -
Ah-ha! With this information, I'll be ready for that {@1_CivAdjective} plot. On a related note, I'm about to come into a few thousand irradiated skeletons, do you need some? -
My third eye has shown me {1_PlayerName} is plotting against you. [NEWLINE] ...I call my spy network 'my third eye'. It sounds more mystical that way, don't you think? -
My third eye has shown me {1_PlayerName} is planning to attack {2_CityName}. [NEWLINE] ...I call my spy network 'my third eye'. It sounds more mystical that way, don't you think? -
My third eye has shown me {1_PlayerName} is planning to attack one of your cities. [NEWLINE] ...I call my spy network 'my third eye'. It sounds more mystical that way, don't you think? -
My third eye has shown me {1_PlayerName} is planning a naval attack on {2_CityName}. [NEWLINE] ...I call my spy network 'my third eye'. It sounds more mystical that way, don't you think? -
My third eye has shown me {1_PlayerName} is planning a naval attack on one of your cities. [NEWLINE] ...I call my spy network 'my third eye'. It sounds more mystical that way, don't you think? -
I caught your spy and shipped them back to your homeland. While they didn't steal any technology for you, maybe the radioactive liquid I reduced them to will help your research somehow. -
I hear you caught and killed one of my spies. While I WAS spying on you, it's only because you didn't just give me all the technology I asked for, so... call it even? -
Oh, this is gonna be about that whole spying thing, isn't it? -
Someone broke into the fusion labs last night and made off with several classified documents, as well as my top-secret fusion-grilled barbecue sandwich. You wouldn't have anything to do with that, would you? -
Stop trying to convert my citizens to your religion! I mean, half of us live in actual, literal Buddhist Hells, so why you'd want to convince people that they don't need to worry about the Yama is anyone's guess. -
Yeah, I should have known you wouldn't buy that. -
I'm glad we can look past this whole mess. -
Good. We don't need to mess with each other's faith. Even though I live in a place that objectively proves my faith is correct. -
Ugh, you're a religious weirdo. -
Okay, if you really want to, I'll tell the missionaries to stop spreading the word in your lands. Don't come crying to me when your people wind up in Hell -- I'll probably come to you and make you put them somewhere else. -
No! The souls of your citizens must accept the truth if they are to be kept out of Hell! And I don't want a bunch of people just popping up in Hell when I finally got everything organized the way I like it! -
Surrender or be obliterated. You don't have much time left to choose... -
I ask myself, what would Satori do? So I am willing to accept your surrender instead of flash-roasting you until nothing remains but a heat shadow on the walls of your ruined palace. Satori is very kind that way. -
Give up yet? Or are you still determined to meet death at my hand?
-
I'd love to see you try and stop me. -
Darn right. -
Don't be like that! I barely melted anyone, why does this have to be a big deal? -
Okay, we cool. -
I'd make an offer, but nothing I have would be worth it for you. -
I can't give you what that's worth.
